image.altText: CSIRO logo with tree in the background.

title.children: The CSIRO cuts are just the tip of the iceberg for Australia's science funding

image.altText: A close up side shot of Mark Butler looking serious.

props.synopsis: State and territory leaders express concern about how the federal government is approaching its public hospital funding negotiations. Follow live.

image.altText: A boat on land.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese is refusing to be drawn on how much a program to remove people from Australia's northern waters using repurposed fishing boats is costing, saying it is a legacy project.

title.children: PM says no apologies over Border Force's secret boat returnee scheme

image.altText: Track map 10.30am 19-11 jpg

image.altText: The ASX building exterior.

props.synopsis: ABS figures show workers received an average base pay increase of 3.4 per cent over the year to September, in line with the previous quarter and economist forecasts. Webjet shares soar after a takeover offer from rival Helloworld. Follow live.

title.children: Wages growth data quashes rate cut hopes

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Is wages growth a real increase or decrease?

image.altText: A hand holds a wallet with cash coming out.

props.synopsis: ABS figures show workers received a real pay increase over the past year, but economists warn that is likely to flip over coming months as inflation increases and wages growth slows further.

title.children: Wage growth remains steady, just ahead of inflation

image.altText: Charley wearing a sparkly black leotard with black tights and high heels, posing with her leg kicked up behind her

title.children: ARIAs red carpet: What the stars are wearing at the Australian music awards

image.altText: A man in a suit speaks at a lectern.

props.synopsis: In an address to the National Press Club, Hugh Marks says he inherited a "fearfulness" within the public broadcaster but that it is improving in its response to mistakes and external scrutiny.

title.children: ABC managing director tells journalists not to 'second-guess' their work

title.children: Flying through this global hub is set to get more expensive. Here's why

image.altText: A man on a car bonnet at night time makes a phone gesture with his right hand

props.synopsis: A road rage attack that saw a motorcyclist ride a P-plater's bonnet all the way to a police station has cost him his licence for eight months.

title.children: Road-raging rider loses licence over bonnet ride to police station

image.altText: A collage of the different plans

props.synopsis: As Donald Trump's plan for Gaza gets UN approval, the proposals for how the territory might be developed are circulating and advocates are worried about who they ultimately benefit.

title.children: How 'disaster capitalism' is looking to cash in on Gaza's misery

image.altText: A photo taken from behind of rows of students sitting at desks in black hoodies with "class of 25" written in white and red.

props.synopsis: One parent says her child's cohort at Hobart College was initially given an incorrect formula sheet for their biology exam.

title.children: Parents frustrated by more exam errors months after review

props.synopsis: Superannuation products that fail the federal government's performance test are still offered to those already retired at a potentially huge cost, according to the consumer advocate.

props.synopsis: The chief executive of the CSIRO has defended the decision to cut hundreds of jobs, arguing the organisation needs to alter its priorities to remain relevant.

title.children: 'The cost of science has gone up': CSIRO chief defends job cuts

image.altText: Jess Wilson wearing a white top and blue blazer standing in front of green hedges.

props.synopsis: The Liberals in two big Australian states are realigning themselves — shifting to what Sussan Ley once described as the sensible centre.

title.children: Liberals in two big states are realigning themselves to the centre

image.altText: Gloved hands use tweezers to examine pink coloured sand in a zip-lock bag.

props.synopsis: One Queensland grandmother says her daughter had vacuumed, and even replaced her vacuum cleaner, after removing the asbestos-contaminated sand following "confusing" advice.

title.children: Families left unsure how to clean homes after asbestos sand concerns

props.synopsis: The fire broke out during strong winds on Tuesday evening near a fishing port in the city of Oita and spread to a forest.

title.children: Fire destroys 170 buildings in 'blink of an eye' in southern Japan

image.altText: US President Donald Trump shakes hands with the Saudi Crown Prince smiling.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump warmly welcomes the Saudi crown prince to the White House where he deflects journalists' questions about Mohammed bin Salman's role in the killing of reporter Jamal Khashoggi, saying: "Things happened, but he knew nothing about it."

title.children: 'Things happen': Trump defends Saudi prince over killing of Washington Post journalist

image.altText: An old painting of a woman hanging on a wall.

props.synopsis: A portrait by Gustav Klimt fetched a record price at a New York auction, which also sold a fully functional gold toilet, a satirical artwork by Maurizio Cattelan, for millions.

title.children: Gold toilet, Klimt portrait sell for millions at Sotheby’s

image.altText: A man felxes after weighing in for a boxing match

props.synopsis: After losing three of his past four fights, Tim Tszyu's next bout will be in Sydney as the 31-year old attempts to bring his career back from the brink.

title.children: Tim Tszyu returns to Sydney for next fight as he looks to save a career on the brink

image.altText: A woman with blue hair and rimless glasses in a floral brown cardigan stares off camera as a tram approaches on the road behind.

props.synopsis: Victoria's Auditor-General has found less than one in five tram services in Melbourne are accessible, with the Department of Transport and Planning failing to set any targets or direct funding to improve the tram network.

title.children: Commuters waiting half an hour longer to access low floor trams

image.altText: A boy in a black jumper with a red sash.

props.synopsis: The brother of schoolboy Terry Floyd, who disappeared 50 years ago, has accused the Victorian government of breaking its public promise to fund the search for his remains.

title.children: Victorian government breaks promise to murdered child's family

image.altText: A man and woman sitting at a dining table looking intensely at paperwork and a calculator

props.synopsis: Switching to fortnightly repayments from monthly — if you can afford it — can help you pay down your mortgage faster. Here’s why.

title.children: Should you make mortgage repayments monthly, fortnightly or weekly?

image.altText: Three elderly men standing in front of a shed entrance with a serious look on their face

props.synopsis: The future of the Gympie Men's Shed is in doubt as the search for a new home continues.

title.children: Queensland men's shed still without a home after being evicted

image.altText: A man and young boy (right) hold coloured cards, the boy holds a green one to the camera and looks at the lens.

props.synopsis: With only eight fluent Nyiyaparli speakers remaining, an Aboriginal group is racing against time to save their 41,000-year-old language.

title.children: Game designed to save dying Aboriginal language wins global awards
